snippet: Researchers say a 100,000-year-old workshop in South Africa is the earliest example of how early modern humans processed the reddish pigment known as ocher.
lead_paragraph: Researchers say a 100,000-year-old workshop in South Africa is the earliest example of how early modern humans processed the reddish pigment known as ocher.

headline.main: In African Cave, Signs of an Ancient Paint Factory
headline.print_headline: In African Cave, Ancient Paint Factory Pushes Human Symbolic Thought ‘Far Back’
headline.seo: African Cave Yields Evidence of a Prehistoric Paint Factory
